fields.summary: iOS: Ti.UI.Slider.thumbImage - custom image disappears when slider is being moved and physical pressure object (i.e., your thumb) is too close to the slider button

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When the user's thumb is pressed on the button slider handle, and then the thumb is moved away, the custom thumb handle image disappears and is replaced by the default image. When the thumb is moved closer, the custom image reappears. This is an old issue.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run Kitchen Sink > Controls > Slider > Basic.
2. On the top slider (there are two), press and hold the handle.
3. Move "thumb" (while keeping handle pressed) away from the handle.

Expected Result:

Custom image should remain.

Actual Result:

Custom image disappears.
fields.summary: iOS: KitchenSink: Controls > Slider > Basic: custom thumbImage disappears if user's thumb is too far from thumb handle

comments.body:
Issue  reproduces

Tested with

iOS SDK: 5.1
iOS iPad Simulator: 5.1
iOS iPhone Simulator: 5.1
Mac OS X Version 10.7.5
Titanium SDK version 3.1.1.v20130606121419
Titanium Studio, build: 3.0.1.201212181159
Closing ticket as invalid as there is a new version of Kitchen Sink and we no longer support the old version.
